intro: Draba heterocoma var. archipelagi, commonly known as the island rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and pinnately lobed leaves. This variant is typically found growing in rocky or gravelly soils, often in coastal or alpine environments. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is a hardy, low-growing species adapted to harsh, sunny conditions.
